paragraphs.title: Ephraim Sklyansky
paragraphs.text: Ephraim Markovich Sklyansky (Russian: Эфраим Маркович Склянский ) (August 12 [O.S. July 31] 1892 - August 27, 1925) was a Soviet statesman.

paragraphs.title: Ephraim Sklyansky
paragraphs.text: He joined the Bolsheviks during his years as a student in the medical faculty of Kiev University, from which he graduated in 1916; he was immediately drafted into the army, where he served as a doctor and became prominent in the clandestine military organizations of the Bolsheviks.

paragraphs.title: Ephraim Sklyansky
paragraphs.text: At the time of the October Revolution he was a member of the Military Revolutionary Committee of the Petrograd Soviet; on meeting him in November, Leon Trotsky was so impressed with his "great creative "élan" combined with concentrated attention to detail" that he appointed him his deputy on the Revolutionary Military Council, where he served with distinction during the Russian Civil War (1918-1920) and helped improve the fighting condition of the Red Army—Trotsky called him the Carnot of the Russian Revolution.

paragraphs.title: Ephraim Sklyansky
paragraphs.text: In 1924 his position as Trotsky's deputy was taken over by Grigory Zinoviev's ally Mikhail Frunze.

paragraphs.title: Ephraim Sklyansky
paragraphs.text: Instead, he was made chairman of the Mossukno state textile trust, and the following May he left on a tour of Germany, France, and the United States to acquire technical information.

paragraphs.title: Ephraim Sklyansky
paragraphs.text: On August 27, 1925 he died in a boating accident on Long Lake (New York) along with , the first head of Amtorg Trading Corporation.

paragraphs.title: Ephraim Sklyansky
paragraphs.text: The high-ranking Soviet defector Boris Bazhanov was convinced that Sklyansky had been drowned on Stalin's orders, and the alleged accident had been organized by and Genrikh Yagoda.

paragraphs.title: Mikhail Gorbachev
paragraphs.text: Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev, ( ; Russian: Михаи́л Серге́евич Горбачёв ; ] ; born 2 March 1931) is a former Soviet statesman.

paragraphs.title: Mikhail Gorbachev
paragraphs.text: He was the eighth and last leader of the Soviet Union, having been General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1985 until 1991.

paragraphs.title: Mikhail Gorbachev
paragraphs.text: He was the country's head of state from 1988 until 1991 (titled as Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet from 1988 to 1989, as Chairman of the from 1989 to 1990, and as Soviet Union]] from 1990 to 1991).

paragraphs.title: Nikolai Podgorny
paragraphs.text: Nikolai Viktorovich Podgorny (Russian: Никола́й Ви́кторович Подго́рный ; ] , Ukrainian: Микола Вікторович Підгорний ; 18 February [O.S. 5 February] 1903 – 11 January 1983) was a Soviet statesman during the Cold War.

paragraphs.title: Nikolai Podgorny
paragraphs.text: He served as First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Ukraine from 1957 to 1963 and as Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet from 1965 to 1977.

paragraphs.title: Nikolai Podgorny
paragraphs.text: He was replaced as Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet in 1977 by General Secretary Leonid Brezhnev.

paragraphs.title: Nikolai Podgorny
paragraphs.text: That same year he lost his seat in the Political Bureau (Politburo) and was forced to resign from active politics.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: David Jonathan Waksberg, born December 14, 1956 in New York City, was a leading activist in the Soviet Jewry Movement during the 1980s and early 1990s.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: In the 1970s he became involved in the Student Struggle for Soviet Jewry.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: In the early 1980s he moved to California and began working for the Bay Area Council for Soviet Jews, first as Assistant Director, and later as Executive Director.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: He initiated public and political activities on behalf of Soviet Jewry, supervised research and monitoring of their welfare and coordinated financial, medical and legal aid to Refuseniks and Prisoners of Conscience trapped in the Soviet Union.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: He organized numerous protest demonstrations and vigils to raise public awareness of the plight of Jews in the USSR.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: In 1985 Waksberg became National Vice-President of BACSJ's umbrella organization, the Union of Councils for Soviet Jews.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: Waksberg frequently visited Jewish communities the Soviet Union and the Former Soviet states and coordinated briefings of the American travelers interested in visiting those communities.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: In 1990 Waksberg took on the role of Director of the Center for Jewish Renewal, newly established by UCSJ.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: The mission of the CJR was to promote the renewal and development of Jewish life in the USSR and the emigration rights, human rights and resettlement needs of Jews in the Former Soviet Union.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: The CJR established a network of human rights and emigration bureaus in major cities of the former Soviet Union.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: In mid-1990s Waksberg was a member of Bay Area Council's Board of Directors and served as Director of Development and Communication of the UCSJ.

paragraphs.title: David Waksberg
paragraphs.text: Since 2007 Waksberg serves as Executive Director of the Bureau of Jewish Education of San Francisco.

paragraphs.title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
paragraphs.text: The Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (Russian: Феликс Дзержинский ) is a "Valerian Kuybyshev"-class (92-016, OL400) Soviet/Russian river cruise ship, cruising in the Volga basin.

paragraphs.title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
paragraphs.text: The ship was built by Slovenské Lodenice at their shipyard in Komárno, Czechoslovakia, and entered service in 1978.

paragraphs.title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
paragraphs.text: She was named after the Soviet statesman Felix Dzerzhinsky alias Iron Felix.

paragraphs.title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
paragraphs.text: At 3,935 tonnes, "Feliks Dzerzhinskiy" is one of the world's biggest river cruise ships.

paragraphs.title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
paragraphs.text: Her sister ships are "Valerian Kuybyshev", "Mikhail Frunze", "Fyodor Shalyapin", "Sergey Kuchkin", "Mstislav Rostropovich", "Aleksandr Suvorov", "Semyon Budyonnyy" and "Georgiy Zhukov".

paragraphs.title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
paragraphs.text: "Feliks Dzerzhinskiy" is currently operated by "Vodohod", a Russian river cruise line.

paragraphs.title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
paragraphs.text: Her home port is currently Nizhny Novgorod.

paragraphs.title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
paragraphs.text: Andrei Pavlovich Kirilenko (Russian: Андре́й Па́влович Кириле́нко ; ] ; 8 September [O.S. 26 August] 1906 – 12 May 1990) was a Soviet statesman from the start to the end of the Cold War.

paragraphs.title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
paragraphs.text: In 1906, Kirilenko was born at Alexeyevka in Belgorod Oblast to a Ukrainian working-class family.

paragraphs.title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
paragraphs.text: He graduated in the 1920s from a local vocational school, and again in the mid-to-late 1930s from the Rybinsk Aviation Technology Institute.

paragraphs.title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
paragraphs.text: He became a member of the All-Union Communist Party (bolsheviks) in 1930.

paragraphs.title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
paragraphs.text: As many like him, Kirilenko climbed up the Soviet hierarchy through the "industrial ladder"; by the 1960s, he was Vice-Chairman of the Bureau of the Central Committee of the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic (RSFSR).

paragraphs.title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
paragraphs.text: After Nikita Khrushchev's forced resignation, Kirilenko became Leonid Brezhnev's "chief lieutenant" within the Central Committee.

paragraphs.title: Anastas Mikoyan
paragraphs.text: Anastas Ivanovich Mikoyan ; 25 November 1895 – 21 October 1978) was an Old Bolshevik and Soviet statesman during the mandates of Lenin, Stalin, Khrushchev, and Brezhnev.

paragraphs.title: Anastas Mikoyan
paragraphs.text: He was the only Soviet politician who managed to remain at the highest levels of power within the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, as that power oscillated between the Central Committee and the Politburo, from the latter days of Lenin's rule, throughout the eras of Stalin and Khrushchev, until his peaceful retirement after the first months of Brezhnev's rule.

paragraphs.title: MS Excelsior Neptune
paragraphs.text: MS "Excelsior Neptune" (originally, the "Feliks Dzerzhinskiy") was an ocean liner owned by the Soviet Union's Black Sea Shipping Company.

paragraphs.title: MS Excelsior Neptune
paragraphs.text: She was built in 1958 by VEB Mathias-Thesen Werft, Wismar, East Germany, as one of the Mikhail Kalinin series of ships.

paragraphs.title: MS Excelsior Neptune
paragraphs.text: It was named after Felix Dzerzhinsky, a Soviet statesman and founder of the Soviet secret police (Cheka).

paragraphs.title: Sergo Mikoyan
paragraphs.text: Sergo Anastasi Mikoyan (Armenian: Սերգո Անաստասի Միկոյան ; Russian: Сергo Анаста́сович Микоян ; June 5, 1929 – March 7, 2010) was one of the Soviet Union's leading historians who specialized on the foreign policies of the Soviet Union and the United States in Latin America.

paragraphs.title: Sergo Mikoyan
paragraphs.text: He was the son of Anastas Mikoyan, an Old Bolshevik and high level Soviet statesman and adviser to Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev.

paragraphs.title: Mikhail Suslov
paragraphs.text: Mikhail Andreyevich Suslov (Russian: Михаи́л Андре́евич Су́слов ; 21 November [O.S. 8 November] 1902 25 January 1982) was a Soviet statesman during the Cold War.

paragraphs.title: Mikhail Suslov
paragraphs.text: He served as Second Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1965, and as unofficial Chief Ideologue of the Party until his death in 1982.

paragraphs.title: Mikhail Suslov
paragraphs.text: Suslov was responsible for party democracy and the power separation within the Communist Party.

paragraphs.title: Mikhail Suslov
paragraphs.text: His hardline attitude toward change made him one of the foremost anti-reformist Soviet leaders.

question: Are Ferocactus and Silene both types of plant?

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: Silene menziesii is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names Menzies' campion and Menzies' catchfly.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: It is native to western North America from Alaska through the western half of Canada to the southwestern United States.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: It can be found in many types of habitat and it is quite common in much of its range.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: It is variable in morphology and there are a number of varied subtaxa.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: In general, it is a perennial herb growing from a caudex, appearing matlike, decumbent, or erect, with stems a few centimeters to over half a meter long.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: It is usually hairy in texture, with upper parts bearing sticky glandular hairs.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: The leaves are lance-shaped, oppositely arranged in pairs, and a few centimeters in length, upper leaves usually smaller than lower.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: Flowers may occur in a cyme at the top of the stem, or in leaf axils, or both.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: Each is encapsulated in a hairy, veined calyx of fused sepals.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: The petals are white with two lobes at the tips.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: The plant is dioecious with male and female plants producing different flowers.

paragraphs.title: Silene menziesii
paragraphs.text: The male and female flower types look the same externally; the stamens are reduced in female plants and the stigmas are reduced in the male.

paragraphs.title: Silene stenophylla
paragraphs.text: Silene stenophylla is a species of flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae.

paragraphs.title: Silene stenophylla
paragraphs.text: Commonly called narrow-leafed campion, it is a species in the genus "Silene".

paragraphs.title: Silene stenophylla
paragraphs.text: It grows in the Arctic tundra of far eastern Siberia and the mountains of Northern Japan.

paragraphs.title: Silene stenophylla
paragraphs.text: Frozen samples, estimated via radiocarbon dating to be around 32,000 years old, were discovered in the same area as current living specimens, and in 2012 a team of scientists successfully regenerated a plant from the samples.

paragraphs.title: Silene tomentosa
paragraphs.text: Silene tomentosa, the Gibraltar campion, is a very rare flowering plant of the genus "Silene" and the family Caryophyllaceae.

paragraphs.title: Silene tomentosa
paragraphs.text: It is a woody-based perennial about 40cm high, with bilobed flowers ranging from pink to pale violet and is endemic to Gibraltar.

paragraphs.title: Silene oregana
paragraphs.text: Silene oregana is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names Oregon silene, Oregon campion and Oregon catchfly.

paragraphs.title: Silene oregana
paragraphs.text: It is native to the western United States, including the Great Basin, where it grows in habitat such as sagebrush and forests.

paragraphs.title: Silene oregana
paragraphs.text: It is a perennial herb growing from a woody caudex and taproot, sending up an erect, mostly unbranched stem which may be 70 centimeters tall.

paragraphs.title: Silene oregana
paragraphs.text: The lance-shaped leaves are up to 8 centimeters long around the caudex, and shorter farther up the stem.

paragraphs.title: Silene oregana
paragraphs.text: Flowers occur in a terminal cyme and sometimes in leaf axils.

paragraphs.title: Silene oregana
paragraphs.text: Each flower is encapsulated in a hairy, glandular calyx of fused sepals.

paragraphs.title: Silene oregana
paragraphs.text: The five petals are creamy white or pink-tinged in color and each has four to six long, fringelike lobes at the tip.

paragraphs.title: Silene noctiflora
paragraphs.text: Silene noctiflora is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names night-flowering catchfly, nightflowering silene and clammy cockle.

paragraphs.title: Silene noctiflora
paragraphs.text: It is native to Eurasia, but it is known on other continents as an introduced species and sometimes a weed.

paragraphs.title: Silene noctiflora
paragraphs.text: In North America, it is a common weed of grain crops in the Canadian prairie provinces and in much of the United States.

paragraphs.title: Silene noctiflora
paragraphs.text: It grows in fields and in other disturbed habitat.

paragraphs.title: Sex determination in Silene
paragraphs.text: "Silene" are a flowering plant that evolved a dioecious reproductive system.

paragraphs.title: Sex determination in Silene
paragraphs.text: This is made possible through heteromorphic sex chromosomes expressed as XY.

paragraphs.title: Sex determination in Silene
paragraphs.text: "Silene" recently evolved sex chromosomes 5-10 million years ago and are widely used by geneticists and biologists to study the mechanisms of sex determination since they are one of only 39 species across 14 families of angiosperm that possess sex-determining genes.

paragraphs.title: Sex determination in Silene
paragraphs.text: "Silene" are studied because of their ability to produce offspring with a plethora of reproductive systems.

paragraphs.title: Sex determination in Silene
paragraphs.text: The common inference drawn from such studies is that the sex of the offspring is determined by the Y chromosome.

paragraphs.title: Silene conoidea
paragraphs.text: Silene conoidea is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names weed silene and large sand catchfly.

paragraphs.title: Silene conoidea
paragraphs.text: It is native to Eurasia, and it is known in other parts of the world, such as western North America, as a weed.

paragraphs.title: Silene conoidea
paragraphs.text: It is an annual herb growing up to a meter in height with a hairy, partially glandular stem.

paragraphs.title: Silene conoidea
paragraphs.text: The lance-shaped leaves are up to 12 centimeters long near the base of the plant and smaller farther up.

paragraphs.title: Silene conoidea
paragraphs.text: The flower is enclosed in an inflated, hairy, glandular calyx of fused sepals which is ridged with many veins.

paragraphs.title: Silene conoidea
paragraphs.text: It is open at the top, revealing five bright pink petals.

paragraphs.title: Silene antirrhina
paragraphs.text: Silene antirrhina is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names sleepy silene and sleepy catchfly.

paragraphs.title: Silene antirrhina
paragraphs.text: It is native to the Americas, where it is widespread throughout North America and parts of South America.

paragraphs.title: Silene antirrhina
paragraphs.text: It is known in Europe as an introduced species.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: Silene suksdorfii is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names Suksdorf's silene, Suksdorf's catchfly and Cascade alpine campion.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: It is native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States, where it occurs from Washington and Idaho to northern California.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: It is mainly an alpine species, growing in the talus of high mountain slopes.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: It can also be found below the tree line in forested subalpine habitat.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: It is a squat perennial herb producing several erect stems from a leafy, woody caudex.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: It generally takes a clumpy form.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: The stems grow up to 10 or 15 centimeters tall and are hairy in texture, with glandular, sticky areas on the upper parts.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: The leaves occur in tufts around the caudex.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: They are fleshy and coated in soft hairs.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: Solitary flowers arise on erect peduncles.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: Each is encapsulated in an inflated calyx of fused sepals, which is starkly purple-veined and has purplish glandular hairs.

paragraphs.title: Silene suksdorfii
paragraphs.text: The petals are white or purple-tinged and have two lobes at their tips and appendages at their bases.

paragraphs.title: Silene latifolia
paragraphs.text: Silene latifolia (formerly "Melandrium album"), the white campion is a dioecious flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae, native to most of Europe, Western Asia and Northern Africa.

paragraphs.title: Silene latifolia
paragraphs.text: It is a herbaceous annual, occasionally biennial or a short-lived perennial plant, growing to between 40-80 centimetres tall.

paragraphs.title: Silene latifolia
paragraphs.text: It is also known in the USA as bladder campion but should not be confused with "Silene vulgaris", which is more generally called Bladder Campion.

question: Which British first-generation jet-powered medium bomber was used in the South West Pacific theatre of World War II?

paragraphs.title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
paragraphs.text: The Savoia-Marchetti SM.79 "Sparviero" (Italian for sparrowhawk) was a three-engined Italian medium bomber with a wood-and-metal structure.

paragraphs.title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
paragraphs.text: Originally designed as a fast passenger aircraft, between 1937 and 1939 this low-wing monoplane set 26 world records, qualifying it for some time as the fastest medium bomber in the world.

paragraphs.title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
paragraphs.text: It first saw action during the Spanish Civil War and flew on all fronts in which Italy was involved during World War II.

paragraphs.title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
paragraphs.text: It achieved success as a torpedo bomber in the Mediterranean theater, and became the best-known Italian aeroplane of the war.

paragraphs.title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
paragraphs.text: It was easily recognizable due to its distinctive fuselage dorsal "hump", and was well liked by its crews, who nicknamed it "il gobbo maledetto" ("damned hunchback").

paragraphs.title: Tupolev Tu-12
paragraphs.text: The Tupolev Tu-12 (development designation Tu-77) was an experimental Soviet jet-powered medium bomber developed from the successful piston-engined Tupolev Tu-2 bomber after the end of World War II.

paragraphs.title: Tupolev Tu-12
paragraphs.text: It was designed as a transitional aircraft to familiarize Tupolev and the VVS with the issues involved with jet-engined bombers.

paragraphs.title: South West Pacific Area (command)
paragraphs.text: South West Pacific Area (SWPA) was the name given to the Allied supreme military command in the South West Pacific Theatre of World War II.

paragraphs.title: South West Pacific Area (command)
paragraphs.text: It was one of four major Allied commands in the Pacific War.

paragraphs.title: South West Pacific Area (command)
paragraphs.text: SWPA included the Philippines, Borneo, the Dutch East Indies (excluding Sumatra), East Timor, Australia, the Territories of Papua and New Guinea, and the western part of the Solomon Islands.

paragraphs.title: South West Pacific Area (command)
paragraphs.text: It primarily consisted of United States and Australian forces, although Dutch, Filipino, British and other Allied forces also served in the SWPA.

paragraphs.title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
paragraphs.text: The Asiatic-Pacific Theater, was the theater of operations of U.S. forces during World War II in the Pacific War during 1941-45.

paragraphs.title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
paragraphs.text: From mid-1942 until the end of the war in 1945, there were two U.S. operational commands in the Pacific.

paragraphs.title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
paragraphs.text: The Pacific Ocean Areas (POA), divided into the Central Pacific Area, the North Pacific Area and the South Pacific Area, were commanded by Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, Commander-in-Chief Pacific Ocean Areas.

paragraphs.title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
paragraphs.text: The South West Pacific Area (SWPA) was commanded by General Douglas MacArthur, Supreme Allied Commander South West Pacific Area.

paragraphs.title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
paragraphs.text: During 1945, the United States added the United States Strategic Air Forces in the Pacific, commanded by General Carl A. Spaatz.

paragraphs.title: Coastwatchers
paragraphs.text: The Coastwatchers, also known as the Coast Watch Organisation, Combined Field Intelligence Service or Section C, Allied Intelligence Bureau, were Allied military intelligence operatives stationed on remote Pacific islands during World War II to observe enemy movements and rescue stranded Allied personnel.

paragraphs.title: Coastwatchers

paragraphs.title: PNG solution
paragraphs.text: The Regional Resettlement Arrangement between Australia and Papua New Guinea, colloquially known as the PNG solution, is the name given to an Australian government policy in which any asylum seeker who comes to Australia by boat without a visa will be refused settlement in Australia, instead being settled in Papua New Guinea if they are found to be legitimate refugees.

paragraphs.title: PNG solution
paragraphs.text: The policy includes a significant expansion of the Australian immigration detention facility on Manus Island, where refugees will be sent to be processed prior to resettlement in Papua New Guinea, and if their refugee status is found to be non-genuine, they will be either repatriated, sent to a third country other than Australia or remain in detention indefinitely.

paragraphs.title: PNG solution
paragraphs.text: The policy was announced on 19 July 2013 by Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd and Papua New Guinean Prime Minister Peter O'Neill, effective immediately, in response to a growing number of asylum seeker boat arrivals.

paragraphs.title: PNG solution
paragraphs.text: The then Opposition Leader Tony Abbott initially welcomed the policy, while Greens leader Christine Milne and several human rights advocate groups opposed it, with demonstrations protesting the policy held in every major Australian city after the announcement.

paragraphs.title: Reset button technique
paragraphs.text: The reset button technique (based on the idea of "status quo ante") is a plot device that interrupts continuity in works of fiction.

paragraphs.title: Reset button technique
paragraphs.text: Simply put, use of a reset button device returns all characters and situations to the "status quo" they held before a major change of some sort was introduced.

paragraphs.title: Reset button technique
paragraphs.text: Typically it occurs either in the middle of a program and negates a portion of it, or it occurs at the beginning, or very end, of a program to negate all that came before it.

paragraphs.title: Reset button technique
paragraphs.text: Often used in science fiction television series, animated series, soap operas, and comic books, the device allows elaborate and dramatic changes to characters and the fictional universe that might otherwise invalidate the premise of the show with respect to future episodes or issues continuity.

paragraphs.title: Reset button technique
paragraphs.text: Writers may, for example, use the technique to allow the audience to experience the death of the lead character, which traditionally would not be possible without effectively ending the work.

paragraphs.text: Auger electron spectroscopy (AES; pronounced ] in French) is a common analytical technique used specifically in the study of surfaces and, more generally, in the area of materials science.

paragraphs.title: Auger electron spectroscopy
paragraphs.text: Underlying the spectroscopic technique is the Auger effect, as it has come to be called, which is based on the analysis of energetic electrons emitted from an excited atom after a series of internal relaxation events.

paragraphs.title: Auger electron spectroscopy
paragraphs.text: The Auger effect was discovered independently by both Lise Meitner and Pierre Auger in the 1920s.

paragraphs.title: Auger electron spectroscopy
paragraphs.text: Though the discovery was made by Meitner and initially reported in the journal "Zeitschrift für Physik" in 1922, Auger is credited with the discovery in most of the scientific community.

paragraphs.title: Auger electron spectroscopy
paragraphs.text: Until the early 1950s Auger transitions were considered nuisance effects by spectroscopists, not containing much relevant material information, but studied so as to explain anomalies in X-ray spectroscopy data.

paragraphs.title: Auger electron spectroscopy
paragraphs.text: Since 1953 however, AES has become a practical and straightforward characterization technique for probing chemical and compositional surface environments and has found applications in metallurgy, gas-phase chemistry, and throughout the microelectronics industry.

paragraphs.title: Cypress-pine
paragraphs.text: Cypress-pine is the common name used for three closely related genera of conifers in the cypress family Cupressaceae:

paragraphs.title: Fokienia
paragraphs.text: Fokienia is a genus of conifer tree belonging to the cypress family.

paragraphs.title: Fokienia
paragraphs.text: In its characteristics, "Fokienia" is intermediate between the genera of "Chamaecyparis" and "Calocedrus".

paragraphs.title: Fokienia
paragraphs.text: Genetically "Fokienia" is much closer to "Chamaecyparis", and not all researchers recognize "Fokienia" as a separate genus.

paragraphs.title: Fokienia
paragraphs.text: The genus comprises only one living species, Fokienia hodginsii or Fujian cypress (; Vietnamese: "Pơmu" ), and one fossil species ("Fokienia ravenscragensis").

paragraphs.title: Cupressaceae
paragraphs.text: Cupressaceae is a conifer family, the cypress family, with worldwide distribution.

paragraphs.title: Cupressaceae
paragraphs.text: The family includes 27–30 genera (17 monotypic), which include the junipers and redwoods, with about 130–140 species in total.

paragraphs.title: Cupressaceae
paragraphs.text: They are monoecious, subdioecious or (rarely) dioecious trees and shrubs 1 – tall.

paragraphs.title: Cupressaceae
paragraphs.text: The bark of mature trees is commonly orange- to red- brown and of stringy texture, often flaking or peeling in vertical strips, but smooth, scaly or hard and square-cracked in some species.

paragraphs.title: Cupressus
paragraphs.text: The genus Cupressus is one of several genera within the family Cupressaceae that have the common name cypress; for the others, see cypress.

paragraphs.title: Cupressus
paragraphs.text: It is considered a polyphyletic group.

paragraphs.title: Cupressus
paragraphs.text: Based on genetic and morphological analysis, the "Cupressus" genus is found in the Cupressoideae subfamily.

paragraphs.title: Cupressus
paragraphs.text: The common name comes from Old French "cipres" and that from Latin "cyparissus", which is the latinisation of the Greek κυπάρισσος ("kypárissos").

paragraphs.title: Pilgerodendron
paragraphs.text: Pilgerodendron is a genus of conifer belonging to the cypress family Cupressaceae.

paragraphs.title: Pilgerodendron
paragraphs.text: It has only one species, Pilgerodendron uviferum, and is endemic to the Valdivian temperate rain forests and Magellanic subpolar forests of southern Chile and southwestern Argentina.

paragraphs.title: Pilgerodendron
paragraphs.text: It grows from 40 to 55°S in Tierra del Fuego, where it is the southernmost conifer in the world.

paragraphs.title: Pilgerodendron
paragraphs.text: It is a member of subfamily Callitroideae, a group of distinct southern hemisphere genera associated with the Antarctic flora.

paragraphs.title: Frenchman Formation
paragraphs.text: The Frenchman Formation is stratigraphic unit of Late Cretaceous (late Maastrichtian) age in the Western Canada Sedimentary Basin.

paragraphs.title: Frenchman Formation
paragraphs.text: It is present in southern Saskatchewan and the Cypress Hills of southeastern Alberta.

paragraphs.title: Frenchman Formation
paragraphs.text: The formation was defined by G.M. Furnival in 1942 from observations of outcrops along the Frenchman River, between Ravenscrag and Highway 37.

paragraphs.title: Frenchman Formation
paragraphs.text: It contains the youngest of dinosaur genera, much like the Hell Creek Formation in the United States.

paragraphs.title: Libocedrus
paragraphs.text: Libocedrus is a genus of five species of coniferous trees in the cypress family Cupressaceae, native to New Zealand and New Caledonia.

paragraphs.title: Libocedrus
paragraphs.text: The genus is closely related to the South American genera "Pilgerodendron" and "Austrocedrus", and the New Guinean genus "Papuacedrus", both of which are included within "Libocedrus" by some botanists.

paragraphs.title: Libocedrus
paragraphs.text: These genera are rather similar to the Northern Hemisphere genera "Calocedrus" and "Thuja": in earlier days, what is now "Calocedrus" was sometimes included in "Libocedrus".

paragraphs.title: Libocedrus
paragraphs.text: They are much less closely related, as recently confirmed (Gadek et al. 2000).

paragraphs.title: Libocedrus
paragraphs.text: The generic name means "teardrop cedar", apparently referring to drops of resin.

paragraphs.text: Ajugeae is a tribe of the Teucrioideae subfamily of the family Lamiaceae and might contain the genera "Acrymia" , "Ajuga" , "Cymaria" , "Garrettia" , "Holocheila" .

paragraphs.title: Jane Marcus
paragraphs.text: Jane Marcus (1938–2015) was a pioneering feminist literary scholar, specializing in women writers of the Modernist era, but especially in the social and political context of their writings.

paragraphs.title: Jane Marcus
paragraphs.text: Focusing on Virginia Woolf, Rebecca West, and Nancy Cunard, among many others, she devised groundbreaking analyses of Woolf's writings, upending a generation of criticism that ignored feminist, pacifist, and socialist themes in much of Woolf's work and critique of imperialism and bourgeois society.

paragraphs.title: Jane Marcus
paragraphs.text: Marcus's understanding of Woolf's place within the larger context of English literature has become prevailing wisdom today in the fields affected by her theorization and research, despite the controversial nature of her positions when they were originally formulated and how much opposition she garnered from earlier scholars and critics.

paragraphs.text: On the Sunday of this week, the various towns chosen to host this festival put out the result of their grand preparations; local dishes and foods such as roast breadfruit, Green Fig and Salt Fish (The National Dish of Saint Lucia), plantain, king fish, Manicou (opossum), Souse (a soup made with pork and often cucumber), fried bake and floats, Accra (a fried dough which contains salt fish), Paime (otherwise known as Conkies) and a famous dish known as Bouillon (fish, chicken or meat stewed with dasheen, yams, plantains, banana and dumplings) Also local drinks such as Cocoa Tea, Golden Apple Juice, Guava Juice and more.

paragraphs.title: Jounen Kwéyòl
paragraphs.text: Apart from the food part, the event is collaborated with kweyol music some of which have been past down to and from many generations.

paragraphs.title: Jounen Kwéyòl
paragraphs.text: The most widely used instrument besides vocals are the Tambos (drums) and are beaten throughout as people speak in the creole language and have a merry time.

paragraphs.title: Jounen Kwéyòl

paragraphs.title: Jounen Kwéyòl
paragraphs.text: Persons who do not want to wear the extreme layers of skirts and dresses make clothing out of special plaid material called Madras which is one of the cloths used in the national wear.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Medal for Valor
paragraphs.text: The National Intelligence Medal for Valor, formerly the Intelligence Community Medal for Valor, is a decoration of the United States Intelligence Community awarded by the National Intelligence Awards Program led by the Office of the Director of National Intelligence.

paragraphs.title: Ground Intelligence Officer
paragraphs.text: Ground Intelligence Officer (MOS 0203) is a primary military occupation code (or MOS) of an U.S. Marine Corps intelligence officer.

paragraphs.title: Ground Intelligence Officer
paragraphs.text: Ground intelligence officers serve as staff officers and commanders in the operating forces and are responsible for analyzing intelligence and planning, deployment and tactical employment of ground surveillance and reconnaissance units.

paragraphs.title: Ground Intelligence Officer

paragraphs.title: Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency
paragraphs.text: The Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency is an intelligence officer who, upon nomination by the President and confirmation by the Senate, serves as the nation's highest-ranking military intelligence officer.

paragraphs.title: Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency
paragraphs.text: As the chief of the Defense Intelligence Agency, the Director is the primary intelligence adviser to the Secretary of Defense and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and also answers to the Director of National Intelligence through the civilian Under Secretary of Defense for Intelligence.

paragraphs.title: Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency
paragraphs.text: The Director is also the Commander of the Joint Functional Component Command for Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance, a subordinate command of United States Strategic Command.

paragraphs.title: Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency
paragraphs.text: Additionally, he chairs the Military Intelligence Board, which coordinates activities of the entire defense intelligence community.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Cross
paragraphs.text: The National Intelligence Cross is a decoration of the United States Intelligence Community (IC) awarded under the National Intelligence Awards (NIA) Program by the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI).

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Cross
paragraphs.text: It is the highest award presented by the Office of the Director of National Intelligence.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Cross
paragraphs.text: It is equivalent of the Central Intelligence Agency's Distinguished Intelligence Cross.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Medal of Achievement
paragraphs.text: The National Intelligence Medal of Achievement is an award that was presented to members of the United States Intelligence Community, both civilian and military, to recognize significant acts of service to the community as a whole.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Medal of Achievement
paragraphs.text: The National Intelligence Medal of Achievement was replaced with the equivalent National Intelligence Exceptional Achievement Medal, during the restructuring of the National Intelligence Community Awards (NICA) Program, with the revision of Intelligence Community Directive 655 (National Intelligence Awards Program) in 2012.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Superior Service Medal
paragraphs.text: The National Intelligence Superior Service Medal is an award of the National Intelligence Awards Program that recognizes an individual's superior service or a lasting contribution over a long period of time to the United States Intelligence Community and the United States as a whole.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Superior Service Medal
paragraphs.text: The medal ranks below the National Intelligence Distinguished Service Medal, but above the National Intelligence Exceptional Achievement Medal.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Board
paragraphs.text: The National Intelligence Board (formerly the National Foreign Intelligence Board) is a body of senior U.S. intelligence community leaders led by the Director of National Intelligence (DNI).

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Board
paragraphs.text: The Board is tasked with reviewing and approving National Intelligence Estimates (NIEs).

paragraphs.title: Robert Suettinger

paragraphs.title: Robert Suettinger
paragraphs.text: While there, Suettinger oversaw the preparation of national intelligence estimates for the director of the Central Intelligence Agency.

paragraphs.title: Robert Suettinger
paragraphs.text: His areas of specialty included the People's Republic of China and the North Korean nuclear weapons program.

paragraphs.title: Robert Suettinger
paragraphs.text: After working in the Clinton administration, Suettinger has been a senior analyst for the Brookings Institution where he wrote the book "Beyond Tiananmen – The Politics of U.S.-China Relations, 1989-2000".

paragraphs.title: Robert Suettinger
paragraphs.text: He also is a senior advisor at The Stimson Center.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Reform Medal
paragraphs.text: The National Intelligence Reform Medal is an award of the United States Intelligence Community's National Intelligence Awards Program that recognizes extraordinary service in implementing the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Reform Medal
paragraphs.text: The medal ranks below the National Intelligence Superior Service Medal, but above the National Intelligence Exceptional Achievement Medal.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Reform Medal
paragraphs.text: Established 23 May 2007 with the creation of the National Intelligence Awards Program, it was retired in November 2010.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Estimate
paragraphs.text: National Intelligence Estimates (NIEs) are United States federal government documents that are the authoritative assessment of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) on intelligence related to a particular national security issue.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Estimate
paragraphs.text: NIEs are produced by the National Intelligence Council and express the coordinated judgments of the United States Intelligence Community, the group of 16 U.S. intelligence agencies.

paragraphs.title: National Intelligence Estimate
paragraphs.text: NIEs are classified documents prepared for policymakers.

paragraphs.text: The Embassy in London is China's only embassy in the UK, alongside two Consulates-General in Edinburgh and Manchester.

paragraphs.title: Embassy of China, London
paragraphs.text: Established in 1877 as the Chinese Legation, the London mission was China's first permanent overseas diplomatic mission.

paragraphs.title: Embassy of China, London

paragraphs.title: Embassy of China, London

paragraphs.title: Diplomatic mission
paragraphs.text: A diplomatic mission or foreign mission is a group of people from one state or an organisation present in another state to represent the sending state/organisation officially in the receiving state.

paragraphs.title: Diplomatic mission
paragraphs.text: In practice, a diplomatic mission usually denotes the resident mission, namely the embassy, which is the office of a country's diplomatic representatives in the capital city of another country, whereas consulates are diplomatic missions which are not performed in the capital of the receiving state.

paragraphs.title: Diplomatic mission
paragraphs.text: As well as being a diplomatic mission to the country in which it is situated, it may also be a non-resident permanent mission to one or more other countries.

paragraphs.title: Diplomatic mission

paragraphs.title: Diplomatic bag

paragraphs.text: Additionally, a diplomatic bag usually has some form of lock and/or tamper-evident seal attached to it in order to deter or detect interference by unauthorized third parties.

paragraphs.title: Diplomatic bag
paragraphs.text: The most important point is that as long as it is externally marked to show its status, the "bag" has diplomatic immunity from search or seizure, as codified in article 27 of the 1961 Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations.

paragraphs.title: One Rank, One Pension
paragraphs.text: One Rank One Pension (OROP), or "same pension, for same rank, for same length of service, irrespective of the date of retirement", is a longstanding demand of the Indian armed forces and veterans.

paragraphs.title: One Rank, One Pension
paragraphs.text: The demand for pay-pension equity, which underlies the OROP concept, was provoked by the exparte decision by the Indira Gandhi-led Indian National Congress (INC) government, in 1973, two years after the historic victory in the 1971 Bangladesh war, and shortly after Field Marshal SHFJ Manekshaw retired, to decrease armed forces pensions by 20–40 percent, and increase civilian pensions by 20 percent, without consultation with armed forces headquarters.

paragraphs.title: Armed Forces Covenant

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: In June 1941, Roosevelt issued Executive Order 8802, which created the Fair Employment Practice Committee (FEPC).

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: It was the most important federal move in support of the rights of African-Americans between Reconstruction and the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: The President's order stated that the federal government would not hire any person based on their race, color, creed, or national origin.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: The FEPC enforced the order to ban discriminatory hiring within the federal government and in corporations that received federal contracts.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: Millions of blacks and women achieved better jobs and better pay as a result.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: The war brought the race issue to the forefront.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: The Army and Navy had been segregated since the Civil War.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: But by 1940, the African-American vote had largely shifted from Republican to Democrat, and African-American leaders like Walter Francis White of the NAACP and T. Arnold Hill of the Urban League had become recognized as part of the Roosevelt coalition.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: In June 1941, at the urging of A. Philip Randolph, the leading African-American trade unionist, Roosevelt signed an executive order establishing the Fair Employment Practice Committee and prohibiting discrimination by any government agency, including the armed forces.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: In practice the services, particularly the Navy and the Marines, found ways to evade this order — the Marine Corps remained all-white until 1942.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: In September 1942, at Eleanor's instigation, Roosevelt met with a delegation of African-American leaders, who demanded full integration into the forces, including the right to serve in combat roles and in the Navy, the Marine Corps and the United States Army Air Forces.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: Roosevelt agreed, but then did nothing to implement his promise.

paragraphs.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's record on civil rights
paragraphs.text: It was left to his successor, Harry S. Truman, to fully desegregate the armed forces.

paragraphs.title: Armed Forces Day (Poland)
paragraphs.text: Armed Forces Day, known also as the Feast of the Polish Armed Forces (Polish: "Święto Wojska Polskiego" ), is a national holiday celebrated annually on 15 August in Poland, commemorating the anniversary of the 1920 victory over Soviet Russia at the Battle of Warsaw during the Polish–Soviet War.

paragraphs.title: Armed Forces Day (Poland)
paragraphs.text: Armed Forces Day is held in conjunction with the Day of the Assumption of the Virgin Mary, itself a separate public holiday.

paragraphs.title: Armed Forces Day (Poland)
paragraphs.text: The event is marked by military parades, equipment reviews, showcases and remembrances by all branches of the Polish Armed Forces across the country.

paragraphs.title: Armed Forces Day (Poland)
paragraphs.text: One of the most prominent events of the day is in the capital Warsaw, which hosts a large military parade through the city's center.

paragraphs.title: Armed Forces Day (Poland)
paragraphs.text: Originally celebrated during the Second Republic, the holiday was barred by authorities during the communist era beginning in 1947, only to be revived again in 1992.

paragraphs.title: Conscription in the United States
paragraphs.text: Conscription in the United States, commonly known as the draft, has been employed by the federal government of the United States in four conflicts: the American Civil War, World War I, World War II, and the Cold War (including both the Korean and Vietnam Wars).

paragraphs.title: Conscription in the United States
paragraphs.text: The third incarnation of the draft came into being in 1940 through the Selective Training and Service Act.

paragraphs.title: Conscription in the United States
paragraphs.text: It was the country's first peacetime draft.

paragraphs.title: Conscription in the United States
paragraphs.text: From 1940 until 1973, during both peacetime and periods of conflict, men were drafted to fill vacancies in the United States Armed Forces that could not be filled through voluntary means.

paragraphs.title: Conscription in the United States
paragraphs.text: The draft was ended when the United States Armed Forces moved to an all-volunteer military force.

paragraphs.title: Conscription in the United States
paragraphs.text: However, the Selective Service System remains in place as a contingency plan; all male civilians between the ages of 18 and 25 are required to register so that a draft can be readily resumed if needed.

paragraphs.title: Rostker v. Goldberg
paragraphs.text: Rostker v. Goldberg, 453 U.S. 57 (1981) , was a decision of the United States Supreme Court holding that the practice of requiring only men to register for the draft was constitutional.

paragraphs.title: Rostker v. Goldberg
paragraphs.text: After extensive hearings, floor debate and committee sessions on the matter, the United States Congress enacted the law, as it had previously been, to apply to men only.

paragraphs.title: Rostker v. Goldberg
paragraphs.text: Several attorneys, including Robert L. Goldberg, subsequently challenged the gender distinction as unconstitutional.

paragraphs.title: Rostker v. Goldberg
paragraphs.text: (The named defendant is Bernard D. Rostker, Director of the Selective Service System.)

paragraphs.title: Rostker v. Goldberg
paragraphs.text: In a 6-3 decision, the Supreme Court held that this gender distinction was not a violation of the equal protection component of the due process clause, and that the Act would stand as passed.

paragraphs.title: September 16 military parade
paragraphs.text: The 16 September military parade in honour of the anniversary of Mexican Independence is an annual tradition dating back to the late 19th century and the beginning of the professionalisation of the Mexican Armed Forces in the 20th century.

paragraphs.title: September 16 military parade
paragraphs.text: Held yearly in the Zócalo in Mexico City, this parade, the largest of the various parades held simultaneously nationwide on September 16, Mexican Independence Day, is presided by the President of Mexico in the fulfillment of his duty as the Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces.

paragraphs.title: September 16 military parade
paragraphs.text: It is also attended by members of the Cabinet of Mexico, the Congress of the Union, civil service employees, the Secretaries of National Defense and Navy, members of the Mexican Armed Forces and Federal Police, uniformed service veterans, the state diplomatic corps, delegations representing the religious sector, indigenous peoples, sports and the private sector, and the general public.

paragraphs.title: September 16 military parade
paragraphs.text: Seen on TV and the Internet and heard on radio, this is one of the biggest events of the year.

paragraphs.title: September 16 military parade
paragraphs.text: Taking part in this are members of the Mexican Armed Forces and the Federal Police.

paragraphs.title: Sheila Cavanagh

paragraphs.title: Sheila Cavanagh

paragraphs.title: Sheila Cavanagh

paragraphs.title: Sheila Cavanagh

paragraphs.title: Sheila Cavanagh

paragraphs.text: The paper was then published as the British Journal or The Censor from 20 January 1728 until 23 November 1730, and then as the British Journal or The Traveller from 30 November 1730 until 20 March 1731.

paragraphs.title: British Journal of Social Psychology
paragraphs.text: The British Journal of Social Psychology is a peer-reviewed academic journal published by Wiley-Blackwell on behalf of the British Psychological Society.

paragraphs.title: British Journal of Social Psychology
paragraphs.text: It publishes original papers on subjects like social cognition, attitudes, group processes, social influence, intergroup relations, self and identity, nonverbal communication, and social psychological aspects of affect and emotion, and of language and discourse.

paragraphs.title: British Journal of Social Psychology
paragraphs.text: The journal was established in 1962 as the "British Journal of Social and Clinical Psychology" and obtained its current title in 1981.

paragraphs.title: British Journal of Social Psychology
paragraphs.text: According to the "Journal Citation Reports", the journal has a 2010 impact factor of 2.056.

paragraphs.title: Tysons Galleria

paragraphs.text: It is the second-largest mall in McLean/Tysons Corner, and one of the largest in the Washington metropolitan area.

paragraphs.title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
paragraphs.text: Scott's Run Nature Preserve is a nature preserve in Fairfax County, Virginia, United States.

paragraphs.title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
paragraphs.text: Located in McLean, it is bordered by Virginia State Route 193 to its south, Interstate 495 to its east and the Potomac River to its north.

paragraphs.title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
paragraphs.text: It encompasses 336 acre of woodland with its namesake, Scott's Run, flowing through its west side.

paragraphs.title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve

paragraphs.title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
paragraphs.text: The preserve is noted for including eastern hemlocks among its plant life, which are rare for the area.

paragraphs.title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
paragraphs.text: It is a popular destination for recreation and hiking and is operated by the Fairfax County Park Authority.

paragraphs.title: Poughkeepsie Galleria
paragraphs.text: The Poughkeepsie Galleria (locally known as "The Galleria") is an upscale shopping center on U.S. 9 in the Town of Poughkeepsie, New York, located just north of Wappingers Falls, and is the largest shopping center in Dutchess County.

paragraphs.text: The Galleria has an area of 1100000 sqft with two floors containing 140 shops and 14 restaurants as well as a 16-screen, stadium-seating Regal Cinemas theater.

paragraphs.title: Tysons, Virginia
paragraphs.text: Tysons, or formerly “Tysons Corner” is a census-designated place (CDP) and unincorporated community in Fairfax County, Virginia, United States.

paragraphs.title: Tysons, Virginia
paragraphs.text: Located in Northern Virginia between the community of McLean and the town of Vienna along the Capital Beltway (I-495), it lies within the Washington Metropolitan Area.

paragraphs.title: Tysons, Virginia
paragraphs.text: Tysons is home to two super-regional shopping malls—Tysons Corner Center and Tysons Galleria—and the corporate headquarters of numerous companies such as Intelsat, Gannett, Hilton Worldwide, Freddie Mac, Capital One and Booz Allen Hamilton.

paragraphs.title: Tysons, Virginia
paragraphs.text: Tysons is Fairfax County's central business district and a regional commercial center.

paragraphs.text: It has been characterized as a quintessential example of an edge city.

paragraphs.title: Tysons, Virginia

paragraphs.title: McLean, Virginia
paragraphs.text: McLean ( ) is a census-designated place (CDP) in Fairfax County in Northern Virginia.

paragraphs.title: McLean, Virginia
paragraphs.text: McLean is home to many diplomats, businessmen, members of Congress, and high-ranking government officials partially due to its proximity to Washington, D.C. and the Central Intelligence Agency.

paragraphs.title: McLean, Virginia
paragraphs.text: It is the location of Hickory Hill, the former home of Ethel Kennedy, the widow of Robert F. Kennedy.

paragraphs.title: McLean, Virginia

paragraphs.title: McLean, Virginia

paragraphs.title: McLean, Virginia

paragraphs.text: McLean is known for its luxury homes and its high-end shopping destinations: the Tysons Corner Center and the Tysons Galleria.

paragraphs.title: McLean, Virginia
paragraphs.text: The two McLean zip codes - 22101 and 22102 - are among the most expensive ZIP Codes in Virginia and the United States.

paragraphs.text: Tysons Corner Center, located in the Tysons Corner unincorporated area in Fairfax County, Virginia, United States (between McLean and Vienna, Virginia), opened to the public in 1968, becoming one of the first fully enclosed, climate-controlled shopping malls in the Washington metropolitan area.

paragraphs.text: The Cobb Galleria Centre is a meeting and convention center and a shopping center in the Cumberland/Galleria district of Cobb County, northwest of Atlanta, Georgia, in the United States.

paragraphs.text: It is also located next to a cluster of mid-rise office buildings, the Cumberland Mall and the Cobb Energy Performing Arts Centre.

paragraphs.title: Cobb Galleria Centre

paragraphs.title: Cobb Galleria Centre
paragraphs.text: The Galleria Specialty Mall, which pre-dates the convention center, is located downstairs, with meeting halls upstairs.

paragraphs.title: Spring Hill station

paragraphs.title: Owens & Minor
paragraphs.text: Owens & Minor () is a Fortune 500 company based in Mechanicsville, Virginia, just outside of Richmond.

paragraphs.title: Owens & Minor

paragraphs.title: Owens & Minor

paragraphs.title: Owens & Minor
paragraphs.text: Owens & Minor’s customers span the healthcare market from independent hospitals to large integrated healthcare networks, as well as group purchasing organizations, healthcare products manufacturers, and the federal government.

paragraphs.title: Owens & Minor
paragraphs.text: Owens & Minor is headquartered in Mechanicsville, Virginia, and has annualized revenues exceeding $9 billion.

paragraphs.title: Compass Minerals
paragraphs.text: Compass Minerals International, Inc is a United States listed public company that, through its subsidiaries, is a leading producer of minerals, including salt, magnesium chloride, sulfate of potash and other plant nutrition products.

paragraphs.title: Compass Minerals
paragraphs.text: Based in Kansas City, the company provides bulk treated and untreated highway deicing salt to customers in North America and the United Kingdom and plant nutrition products to growers worldwide.

paragraphs.title: Compass Minerals
paragraphs.text: Compass Minerals also produces consumer deicing and water conditioning products, consumer and commercial culinary salt, and other mineral-based products for consumer, agricultural, and industrial applications.

paragraphs.title: Compass Minerals
paragraphs.text: In addition, Compass Minerals provides records management services to businesses throughout the United Kingdom.

paragraphs.title: Cardinal Health
paragraphs.text: Cardinal Health, Inc. is a Fortune 500 health care services company based in Dublin, Ohio.

paragraphs.title: Cardinal Health
paragraphs.text: The company specializes in distribution of pharmaceuticals and medical products, serving more than 100,000 locations.

paragraphs.title: Cardinal Health
paragraphs.text: The company also manufactures medical and surgical products, including gloves, surgical apparel and fluid management products.

paragraphs.title: Cardinal Health
paragraphs.text: In addition, it operates the nation’s largest network of radiopharmacies.

paragraphs.title: Cardinal Health

paragraphs.title: Cardinal Health

paragraphs.title: Cardinal Health
paragraphs.text: The venture was named Red Oak Sourcing and began operations in July 2014.

paragraphs.title: Kingstone Companies
paragraphs.text: Kingstone Companies, Inc., which has its headquarters in Kingston, New York, provides property and casualty insurance products through its subsidiary, Kingstone Insurance Company.

paragraphs.text: It places contracts with the third-party licensed premium finance company through its subsidiary Payments, Inc, a NYS licensed Insurance Premium Finance Company.

paragraphs.title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
paragraphs.text: Jonathan M. Ansell (born August 13, 1950 in Binghamton, New York) is an American entrepreneur and CEO in the insurance and insurtech industry.

paragraphs.title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
paragraphs.text: Ansell is the founder and CEO of insurtech companies Merlinio Technologies and Merlinio Insurance Services, an online digital insurance agency and technology platform serving the millennial market.

paragraphs.text: Before Merlinio, Ansell was a co-founder and CEO of Fusion Company, a global digital merchandising provider that specializes in ancillary products.

paragraphs.title: Jonathan Michael Ansell

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: Terren Scott Peizer dubbed the "Zelig of Wall Street" is currently the Chairman of his personal Los Angeles-based investment company, Acuitas Group Holdings (AGH), which in turn owns 100% of Crede Capital Group (CCG) which invests in public companies, and provides growth capital to small and medium-sized enterprises.

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: Since its inception in June 2009, CCG has provided companies with capital commitments and funding in excess of $1.2 Billion.

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: Besides its ownership of Crede Capital, Acuitas Group owns 72% of Catasys, Inc., a provider of proprietary big data based analytics and predictive modeling driven behavioral health management services for health plans; and owns 100% of NeurMedix, Inc., a biotech company that develops and commercializes disease modifying small molecules to treat neuro-degenerative diseases, such as Parkinson’s disease, Alzheimer’s disease, Migraine disease, Huntington’s disease, ALS, MS, Epilepsy, Traumatic Brain Injury, and Retina disease.

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: Peizer is Founder, Chairman of the three Acuitas companies, and is CEO of Catasys, Inc. and Crede Capital Group.

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: Having developed a bioscience and healthcare expertise, Peizer’s Crede Capital became the largest shareholder in 22nd Century Group, Inc., a public company that is commercializing bio-plant technology to harm-reduce tobacco, creating very low nicotine and very low tar tobacco products which affect levels of addiction and cancer causing carcinogens.

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: On October 1, 2015 New England Journal of Medicine published a landmark study on the company’s very low nicotine spectrum cigarettes.

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: In October 2014, Peizer and 22nd Century formed a JV to commercialize the company’s products in China with China National Tobacco Company, the largest tobacco company in the world and the largest monopoly in China.

paragraphs.title: Terren Peizer
paragraphs.text: China represents over 50% of the worldwide tobacco market.

paragraphs.title: BankUnited

paragraphs.title: BankUnited

paragraphs.title: Schrödinger (company)

paragraphs.title: Clean Power Finance
paragraphs.text: Clean Power Finance, headquartered in San Francisco, California, is a financial services and software company for the residential solar industry.

paragraphs.title: Clean Power Finance
paragraphs.text: Clean Power Finance operates the CPF Market, an online business-to-business platform that connects institutional investors and lenders with residential solar professionals who need solar finance products to grow their businesses.

paragraphs.title: Clean Power Finance

paragraphs.title: Clean Power Finance
paragraphs.text: Third-party investors create solar project finance funds; Clean Power Finance provides origination, underwriting and asset management services to the fund investors and markets investor capital to solar professionals as residential finance products, including solar leases and power purchase agreements (PPAs).

paragraphs.text: He also developed the theory of creative geography, which is the use of the action around a cut to connect otherwise disparate settings into a cohesive narrative.

paragraphs.text: It is also the capital city of the Rabat-Salé-Kénitra administrative region.

paragraphs.title: Caraga
paragraphs.text: Caraga, officially known as the Caraga Administrative Region or simply Caraga Region and designated as Region XIII, is an administrative region in the Philippines occupying the northeastern section of the island of Mindanao.

paragraphs.title: Caraga
paragraphs.text: The Caraga Region was created through "Republic Act No. 7901" on February 23, 1995.

paragraphs.title: Caraga
paragraphs.text: The region comprises five provinces: Agusan del Norte, Agusan del Sur, Surigao del Norte, Surigao del Sur and Dinagat Islands; six cities: Bayugan, Bislig, Butuan, Cabadbaran, Surigao and Tandag; 67 municipalities and 1,311 barangays. Butuan is the regional administrative center.

paragraphs.title: Visa policy of Hong Kong
paragraphs.text: The visa policy of Hong Kong deals with the requirements in which a foreign national wishing to enter the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region must meet to obtain an entry permit or visa, which depending on the traveller's nationality, may be required to travel to, enter, and remain in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

paragraphs.title: Visa policy of Hong Kong
paragraphs.text: Visitors from over 145 countries are permitted visa-free entry for periods ranging from 7 to 180 days, to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region for tourism or certain business-related activities.

paragraphs.title: Visa policy of Hong Kong
paragraphs.text: All visitors must hold a passport valid for more than 1 month.

paragraphs.title: Sinuiju Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: Sinŭiju Special Administrative Region is a special administrative region (SAR) of North Korea proclaimed in 2002 (but has not been put into "de facto" operation as of 2014), on the border with China.

paragraphs.title: Sinuiju Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: It was established in September 2002 in an area including parts of Sinŭiju and the surrounding area, in an attempt to introduce market economics, and is directly governed as in the case of "Directly Governed Cities".

paragraphs.title: Sinuiju Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: The special administrative region was modelled after China's Special Administrative Regions (SARs), Hong Kong and Macau, and, like them, has a "Basic Law" (기본법; Kibonpŏp).

paragraphs.title: Hong Kong Basic Law
paragraphs.text: The Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China is the constitutional document of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

paragraphs.title: Hong Kong Basic Law
paragraphs.text: Being a national law of the People's Republic of China, the Basic Law was adopted on 4 April 1990 by the Seventh National People's Congress and signed by President Yang Shangkun.

paragraphs.title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: The Wolong Special Administrative Region () is an area in Sichuan, China.

paragraphs.title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: It is located in the southwest of Wenchuan County, Ngawa Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture of Sichuan.

paragraphs.title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: It was formerly known as Wolong Special Administrative Region of Wenchuan County, Sichuan Province and was founded in March 1983 with approval of the State Council.

paragraphs.title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: It was given its current name and placed under Sichuan provincial government with administrative supervision by the provincial department of forestry.

paragraphs.title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: Its area supersedes Sichuan Wolong National Nature Reserve and its administrative office is the same as the Administrative Bureau of the State Forestry Administration for the reserve.

paragraphs.title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
paragraphs.text: It currently has a population of 5343.

paragraphs.title: Ilocos Region
paragraphs.text: The Ilocos Region (Ilocano: "Rehion/Deppaar ti Ilocos" ; Pangasinan: "Sagor na Baybay na Luzon" ; Filipino: "Rehiyon ng Ilocos" ) is an administrative region of the Philippines, designated as Region I, occupying the northwestern section of Luzon.

paragraphs.title: Ilocos Region
paragraphs.text: It is bordered by the Cordillera Administrative Region to the east, the Cagayan Valley to the northeast and southeast, and the Central Luzon to the south.

paragraphs.title: Ilocos Region
paragraphs.text: To the west lies the South China Sea.

paragraphs.title: 2014 NPCSC Decision on Hong Kong
paragraphs.text: The Decision of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress on Issues Relating to the Selection of the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region by Universal Suffrage and on the Method for Forming the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region in the Year 2016 (), commonly known as 31 August Decision (), is a decision made by the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress (NPCSC), the national legislative body of the People's Republic of China (PRC) on 31 August 2014 which set limits for the 2017 Chief Executive election and 2016 Legislative Council election in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR).

paragraphs.title: Rocket of China (TV series)
paragraphs.text: Rocket of China (Chinese: 龙号机车; pinyin: Lóng Hào Jī Chē) is a Chinese historical comedy set in nineteenth century China based on the true story of the history of the construction of , the first steam locomotive made in China, with the help of an English engineer Claude W. Kinder (Jin Da) who in 1878 travelled to Qing Dynasty China in the hope of building the first railway through China.

paragraphs.title: Rocket of China (TV series)
paragraphs.text: The 30 episode comedy was directed by and written by Man Yu.

paragraphs.title: Rocket of China (TV series)
paragraphs.text: Appearing in the comedy are , , Liu Jin Shan, Ma Ling, Yu Hui Zi, Li Jian Hua, Li Qi, Na Wei, , Yan Guan, Qi Xiao Fei, Isabella Charlton (Zhou Xiaolin), Karl Robert Eislen, Jonathan Kos-Read and among others.

paragraphs.title: Rocket of China (TV series)
paragraphs.text: It was produced by Xui Ji Wei in the Production Company of Long Teng Yi Du (Beijing) Film Investment Co., Ltd.

paragraphs.title: Rocket of China (TV series)
paragraphs.text: The comedy was first aired on Public Channel on 1 February 2016.

question: Are Yingkou and Fuding the same level of city?

paragraphs.title: Bayuquan Railway Station
paragraphs.text: Bayuquan Railway Station (IATA: JYQ) is a railway station of the Harbin–Dalian section of the Beijing–Harbin High-Speed Railway.

paragraphs.title: Bayuquan Railway Station
paragraphs.text: It is located in Bayuquan, in the Yingkou prefecture level city, in the Liaoning province of China.

paragraphs.title: Shengjing Bank
paragraphs.text: Shengjing Bank (in ) is a commercial bank, with its headquarters in Shenyang, Liaoning Province, China.

paragraphs.title: Shengjing Bank
paragraphs.text: It was established in 1996 as Shenyang City Commercial Bank and opened in Shenyang City only.

paragraphs.title: Shengjing Bank
paragraphs.text: It changed its name to Shengjing Bank in 2007 and has since opened a branch in Beijing, Tianjin, Dalian, Yingkou, Huludao, Shanghai, Anshan, Changchun, Benxi, Panjin, Chaoyang, Fushun, Jinzhou, Fuxin, Dandong and Liaoyang.

paragraphs.title: Xiapu County
paragraphs.text: Xiapu (; Foochow Romanized: Hà-puō) is a county in the municipal region of Ningde, Fujian, People's Republic of China, located along a stretch of East China Sea coast, with many harbours and islands.

paragraphs.title: Xiapu County
paragraphs.text: It is bordered by Fuding City and Zherong County to the north, Fu'an City and Ningde's urban area to the west, and—in Fuzhou City—Luoyuan County to the south.

paragraphs.title: Wafangdian
paragraphs.text: Wafangdian (), formerly Fuxian or Fu County (), is one of the two "northern county-level cities", the other being Zhuanghe, under the administration of Dalian, located in the south of Liaoning province, China.

paragraphs.title: Wafangdian
paragraphs.text: The city is famous for its ball bearing industry.

paragraphs.title: Wafangdian
paragraphs.text: Wafangdian Bearing Factory is the largest bearing manufacturer in Asia and was initially built by the Japanese during World War II.

paragraphs.title: Wafangdian
paragraphs.text: Its area is 3576.40 km² and its permanent population as of 2010 is 942,197, compared to 1,024,876 registered with hukou permits.

paragraphs.title: Wafangdian
paragraphs.text: The city borders the prefecture-level city of Yingkou to the northeast.

paragraphs.title: Fuding Railway Station
paragraphs.text: Fuding Railway Station () is a railway station located in Fuding City, Ningde, Fujian Province, China, on the Wenzhou-Fuzhou Railway operated by the Nanchang Railway Bureau, China Railway Corporation.

paragraphs.title: Yingkou East Railway Station
paragraphs.text: Yingkou East Railway Station (IATA: YDD) is a railway station of Beijing–Harbin High-Speed Railway, in particular of both the Panjin–Yingkou and Harbin–Dalian sub-sections.

paragraphs.title: Yingkou East Railway Station
paragraphs.text: It is located in Dashiqiao, in the Yingkou prefecture level city, in the Liaoning province of China.

paragraphs.title: Yingkou Lanqi Airport
paragraphs.text: Yingkou Lanqi Airport (IATA: YKH, ICAO: ZYYK) is an airport serving the city of Yingkou in Liaoning province of Northeast China.

paragraphs.title: Yingkou Lanqi Airport
paragraphs.text: It is located in Lanqi Village in Xishi District of Yingkou, about 17 km from the city center by road.

paragraphs.title: Yingkou Lanqi Airport
paragraphs.text: The airport opened on 3 February 2016, when the inaugural China Eastern Airlines flight landed from Shanghai Pudong International Airport.

paragraphs.title: Yingkou Lanqi Airport
paragraphs.text: The total investment for the project was estimated at CNY 8.94 billion.

paragraphs.title: Taimushan Railway Station
paragraphs.text: Mount Taimu Railway Station () is a railway station located in Fuding City, Ningde, Fujian Province, China, on the Wenzhou-Fuzhou Railway operated by the Nanchang Railway Bureau, China Railway Corporation.

paragraphs.title: Tongcheng Subdistrict, Fuding
paragraphs.text: Tongcheng () is a subdistrict of the city of Fuding, Fujian, People's Republic of China.

paragraphs.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Yingkou
paragraphs.text: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Yingkou/Yingkow (Latin: "Imcheuven(sis)" , ) is a diocese located in the city of Yingkou in the Ecclesiastical province of Shenyang 瀋陽 in China.
